MK.evidence: The Confucius Institute in Skopje is the only one in the country and is opened in 2013 at the oldest and most renowned public University, "St. Cyril and Methodius". Moreover, there are Confucius classrooms open in a number of municipalities across the country. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. A research report dubbed "Understanding the tools, narratives and influence of Chinese 'soft power' in North Macedonia" by the author Ana Krstinovska, which was published by ESTIMA and the Konrad Adenauer Foundation near the end of 2022, points out that probably the most important long-term tool for strengthening Chinese soft power in North Macedonia is the opening of this institute. This has resulted in gradual but constant increase of studentrs who learn or have learned the Chinese language and culture which currenlty accounts for several hundred people. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
MK.note: Aditionally, sources tell us that Confucius classrooms do exist in a number of municipalities across the country but according to this source they offer only language classes.
MK.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TR.evidence: There are four Confucius Institutes and two Confucius Classrooms at Turkey’s most prestigious universities and schools. Middle East Technical University, Bosporus University, Yeditepe University and Okan University have institutes while Okan College and Jale Tezer College have classrooms.Therefore, this indicator desrves a "More than a few" rating. There is a growing number of students who attend and show interest in the Chinese language. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.
TR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

IS.evidence:

UA.evidence: Despite the full-scale invasion of Russia, they continue to work. In particular, the Confucius Institute at Kharkiv National University (KhNU) named after V.M. Karazin.

ES.evidence: There are either Confucious Institutes or classrooms at universities in almost every autonomous community in Spain.

TM.evidence: Yes, in Turkmenistan, there are PRC-affiliated Chinese language centers based at universities. These institutions include the International University for the Humanities and Development, the Magtymguly Turkmen State University, and the D. Azadi Turkmen National Institute of World Languages.

IN.evidence: There are a few Confucius Institutes in Indian Universities as listed in links and as such the indicator deserves a "few" rating. At the same time, after the 2020 border clashes, there has been enhanced scrutiny on the functioning of such institutes.
IN.note: In recent years, some Confucius Institutes have been renamed or rebranded, but still maintain connections with the CCP. This Indicator includes Chinese language centers that operate in the same manner as Confucius Institutes. It does not include Chinese language centers that merely offer exchanges to PRC-based language institutes (language exchanges). See this report: https://www.universityworldnews.com/post.php?story=20220630152610783

NG.evidence: Unizik and Unilag both have Confucius Institutes. University of Lagos is a prominent university, therefore this indicator deserves a "few" and "significant" rating.

ZA.evidence: There are Confucius institutes at the University of Cape Town,1 Durban's University of Technology, the University of the Western Cape, the University of Johannesburg (2) (and there is a partnership for language lessons with the University of the Witwatersrand) (3), Stellenbosch University (4), Rhodes University (5). As at 2020, the institute at University of Nairobi had enrolled close to 20,000 students to learn Chinese. BR.evidence: In Brazil, Confucius Institutes have been operating since 2008. The first Confucius Institute opened in Brazil was in São Paulo, through an agreement with the University of Hubei and Unesp (Universidade Estadual Paulista). Currently, the Confucius Institute at Unesp is present, in addition to the capital of São Paulo, in 12 cities in the interior of São Paulo where Unesp maintains teaching units. It is also present in the cities of Manaus-AM and São Luís-MA, through agreements signed with the Federal University of Maranhão (UFMA) and the Federal University of Amazonas (UFAM). There are also Confucius Institutes at the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul (UFRGS), the University of Brasília (UnB), the Federal University of Minas Gerais (UFMG), the Pontifical Catholic University (PUC-Rio), the University of the State of Pará ( UEPA), at the State University of Campinas (UNICAMP), at the University of Pernambuco and at the Federal University of Ceará (UFC).

NP.evidence: While as per reports on Chinese media, only a second University in Nepal has recently in 2023 opened a Confucius Institute, fact is that teaching of Chinese language courses in schools is coordinated by Chinese sponsored Confucius Institutes. The Confucius Institute at Kathmandu University has trained nearly 50,000 Chinese-language professionals for Nepal since its inception 16 years ago. There are other Confucius Studies that also are active in Nepal. There are already 85 private and public schools offering Chinese-language courses in Nepal, according to the Kathmandu Post. TH.evidence:
The Confucius Institute at Chulalongkorn University, Thailand’s leading public university, is part of a broader network, with Thailand hosting 15 Confucius Institutes across the country. On June 6, 2023, Mahidol University, in cooperation with Beijing Language and Culture University in China, held an opening ceremony for a new Confucius Institute at Mahidol.

According to the research titled Cultural Diplomacy of China towards Thailand through the Confucius Institutes (2023), since the establishment of these institutes in 2006, China’s use of soft power through language and cultural education has significantly benefited Thai society. The key impacts include the enhancement of Chinese language teaching in Thailand, the creation of learning opportunities, and strengthened cooperation between Thai and Chinese agencies. Currently, both countries have further elevated their educational cooperation to enhance the quality of Chinese language and culture instruction in Thailand.
TH.answerer: Answered by Pravit Rojanaphruk, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ID.evidence:
Indonesia is the second country with the most Confucius Institute Centers in ASEAN. There are at least 8 Confucius Institute Centers today. This development began in 2010 in line with the increasing public interest in Mandarin. Counfucius Institute can also be found in several tertiary institutions in Indonesia, for example at Al-Azhar Indonesia University in Jakarta, Muhammadiyah Malang University in East Java, Tanjungpura University in West Kalimantan, Maranatha Christian University in Bandung, and Surabaya State University in Surabaya.

China's soft power efforts through culture are quite accepted in Indonesia, one of which is with the Confucius Institute, although they do not have a large enough influence.

KH.evidence: Yes, Confucius Institutes operate at Cambodian universities.

DE.evidence: There are 19 Confucius Institutes in Germany. Most Confucius Institutes have been established at a German university.

GB.evidence: A Henry Jackson Society report lists 30 Confucius Institutes in the UK, more than any other country, with the Institutes reaching well over 100 schools. There are also 39 Confucius Classrooms. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a 'More than a few' rating. The Institutes are deeply integrated into the UK's Chinese-language education system, with the University College London Institute of Education Confucius Institute for Schools being one of the main entities responsible for delivering the government-funded Mandarin Excellence Programme. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a 'Significant' rating.

AU.evidence:
At its peak, there were 14 Confucius Institutes in Australia, and 11 still remain to this day, including six well-known universities in the Group of Eight. There were 67 Confucius Classrooms in Australia at its peak, but many of them have been shut down. It is unclear how many of them remain active.

At one point, Australia had the third most Confucius Institutes/Classrooms globally, just behind the US and the UK. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a 'More than a few' rating. Given the size of Australia's population, this Indicator deserves a 'Significant' rating.
AU.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Kevin Mooney and Andrew Yeh

IL.evidence: There are two Confucius Institutes in Israel: one at Tel Aviv University and another at the Hebrew University. Both focus on culture, language, literature, and related topics.
